About the Project

Novel(ty) on Stage is an ongoing database project that attempts to record and detail all dramatic adaptations of non-dramatic texts, and all adaptations of dramatic works into non-dramatic prose forms, from 1660-1843: including dramatic adaptations of novels, short stories, and poetry, and novelistic adaptations of stage productions. Learn more about the selection criteria for the database here.

This project is being developed by Cassidy Holahan, PhD Candidate in the English Department at the University of Pennsylvania. This project was made possible the support of a Mellon Mid-Doctoral Fellowship at Penn’s Price Lab for Digital Humanities, funded by the the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

To learn more about how this project was made and funded, see the credits.
